intro: Echites ovatus, commonly known as the oval echites, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, ovate-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
